13.	Contractors 
Prior to selecting a contractor, Verdant completes an evaluation of the safety performance of the contractor. Verdant trains contract employees on potential hazards related to the contractor's work and the Covered Process. Contractors are also informed of the procedures for emergency response should an accidental release of EO or PO.

Maintenance operations are carried out by qualified personnel with previous training in maintenance practices. Equipment deficiencies identified by the maintenance checks are corrected in a safe and timely manner. 
8.	Management Of Change (MOC)
Verdant has a written Management of Change process for the Covered Process to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment, and procedures. Process operators, maintenance personnel, or other employees whose tasks are affected by a modification in process conditions are promptly made aware of and offered training to address the modifications. 
9.	Pre-Startup Safety Review (PSSR)
Verdant has a Pre-startup Safety Review program for the Covered Process. The facility performs Pre-start up safety reviews related to new processes and to modifications of the Covered Process. The reviews are conducted to confirm that construction, equipment, operating, and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe start-up prior to placing equipment into operation. A completed PSSR is required prior to introducing hazardous materials to the process.
10.	Compliance Audits
Verdant conducts audits on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions set out under the RMP regulation are being implemented. The last compliance audit for the facility was completed in December of 2022.
11.	Incident Investigation
Verdant investigates incidents that have resulted in, or could reasonably result in a catastrophic release of EO or PO. These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring. Incident Investigation reports related to the Covered Process are retained for a minimum of five years.

3.	Process Safety Information (PSI)
Verdant maintains a Process Safety Information (PSI) record that describes chemical hazards, operating parameters, and equipment designs associated with the regulated substance and Covered Process.

4.	Worst-Case and Alternate-Case Release Scenarios

Information on the worst-case and alternative-case release scenarios is maintained in the Baze Chemical Palestine Facility Offsite Consequence Analysis report.

5.	Process Hazardous Analysis (PHA)

Verdant conducted PHA studies to identify hazards associated with its Covered Process and review if appropriate controls were in place. Studies undertaken by teams of qualified personnel with expertise in engineering and process operations and were revalidated at least every five years. Findings and recommendations related to the PHAs were addressed in a timely manner. The most recent PHA for the Covered Process was completed in January of 2023. 

6. Operating Procedures
Verdant maintains written operating procedures to safely conduct activities in the Covered Process. These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial startup, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency operations, normal shutdown, and startup after a turnaround. The information is regularly reviewed and is readily accessible to operators involved in these processes.

6.	Training 
Verdant has a training program to for employees tasked with operational processes and procedures. Refresher training is provided at least once every three years. Verdant maintains records of the training that has been provided to employees.

Risk Management Plan (RMP) Executive Summary – Baze Chemicals Palestine 

Verdant Specialty Solutions (Verdant) is required to develop a RMP for the Ethylene Oxide (EO) and Propylene Oxide (PO) stored and processed at the Baze Chemical -  Palestine Plant located in Palestine, Texas hereafter referred to as the Covered Process. 
As required by 40 CFR 68.155, Verdant developed this RMP Executive Summary for the subject process.

1.	Facility and Regulated Substances

Verdant has two regulated substances EO and PO at Palestine Plant. The Palestine Plant is used for the manufacture of alkylated specialty chemicals (e.g., emulsion breakers, surfactants), which are predominantly used in the oil and gas industry. The process involves reacting ethylene oxide with various common chemicals, such as fatty alcohols and phenols, to produce a variety of products.
The facility is subject to the Program Level 3 RMP requirements. [The OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) regulation also applies to the facility because the EO onsite exceed the PSM limit of 5,000 pounds.]
The following sections briefly describe the elements of the Verdant release prevention program that are in place at the Palestine Plant. 
2.	Emergency Action Plan

Verdant complies with applicable federal, state, and local regulations related to emergency response plans. This facility has an emergency action plan that provides instructions to employees on how to respond to an emergency. Employees and contractors at the facility are trained in the key aspects of the emergency action plan. Employees and contractors are also informed of hazards in the workplace. Employees who work with potentially hazardous substances receive proper training.
